title: What are the key Cost Types?
description: Uncover how businesses categorize their expenses. Some stay constant, others change with production.

words.fact: Fixed Costs: Expenses that remain constant regardless of production volume. Examples include rent, salaries, insurance, and depreciation.
Variable Costs: Expenses that change in proportion to production activity. Examples include raw materials, direct labor, and packaging.
Direct Costs: Expenses directly traceable to a specific product or service. Examples include materials used in manufacturing and wages of production workers.
Indirect Costs: Expenses that cannot be directly traced to a specific product. Also called overhead. Examples include utilities, maintenance, and administrative salaries.
